Interface List<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ArrayList, DoubleLinkedArrayList, LinkedList, SortableArrayList, SortedArrayList

    public interface List<T>
    Interface for a generic List
    Version:
    1.0 - 24.09.2016
    Author:
    Moritz HÃ¶wer

    • Method Detail

      • insert

        List<T> insert(int index,
               T value)
        Inserts a new value into the list at a given index
        Parameters:
        index - the index at which to insert a new value
        value - the value to insert
        Returns:
        this for chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - when index is invalid

      • delete

        List<T> delete(int index)
        Delete a value at a specific index
        Parameters:
        index - the index at which to delete
        Returns:
        this for chaining
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - when index is invalid

      • find

        java.util.OptionalInt find(T value)
        Find a value in the list
        Parameters:
        value - the value to be searched for
        Returns:
        an OptionalInt that contains the index or is empty if nothing was found

      • retrieve

        T retrieve(int index)
        Retrieves a value from the list
        Parameters:
        index - the index where to retrieve a value from
        Returns:
        the value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - when index is invalid

      • concat

        List<T> concat(List<T> other)
        Appends the content of another List<T> to this
        Parameters:
        other - the List<T> to be appended
        Returns:
        this with the contents of other appended

      • size

        int size()
        Calculates the number of elements in this list
        Returns:
        the number of elements
